mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to David Humphreys, 1786 June 20
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Congratulations on return to America [from London] -- invites him to Mt. Vernon -- "The only design of this letter is to assure you that you will have no occasion for Horses, for mine will always be at your service; and very little for a Servant, as your old acquaintance Will [Lee] (now fit for little else) can whiten your head, and many idlers about the House can blacken your Shoes ..." -- sends letter under cover to Col. Lee. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, laminated. Name on original manuscript appears as "G. Washington". |
